Original: Tama:Ah! It's...it's the-true! How did I the-miss it? I can sense the bridge's the-presence!
Dialogue: Ah! It's...it's the-true! How did I the-miss it? I can sense the bridge's the-presence!

Original: Lann:Dude... This thing isalive?Holy schlep!
Dialogue: Dude... This thing is alive? Holy schlep!

Original: Eiko:Andthat'swhy a summoner like me has to look after him.
Dialogue: And that's why a summoner like me has to look after him.

Original: Reynn:Oh wow! So you're a summoner, then!
Dialogue: Oh wow! So you're a summoner, then!

Original: Eiko:Yeah, but it's not likeI'mthe one that summoned him...
Dialogue: Yeah, but it's not like I'm the one that summoned him...

Original: Eiko:Are you them? The one and only Jiants from the Hills?
Dialogue: Are you them? The one and only Jiants from the Hills?

Original: Lann:You bet!
Dialogue: You bet!

Original: Reynn:Yeah, that's...the word.
Dialogue: Yeah, that's...the word.

Original: Eiko:Sooo...I guess that means it's true.
Dialogue: Sooo...I guess that means it's true.

Original: Eiko:Nobody remembers 'cause they're so caught up in the Crimson Prophecy.
Dialogue: Nobody remembers 'cause they're so caught up in the Crimson Prophecy.

Original: Reynn:Oh, that's right. Princess Sarahdidtell us about the divergence.
Dialogue: Oh, that's right. Princess Sarah did tell us about the divergence.

Original: Lann:Wait, the what?
Dialogue: Wait, the what?

Original: Tama:You the-mean you forgot?
Dialogue: You the-mean you forgot?

Original: Eiko:I'm starting to worry... Maybe I shouldn't let you use the bridge.
Dialogue: I'm starting to worry... Maybe I shouldn't let you use the bridge.

Original: Lann:Oh, no. We're cool! Me and Reynn are totally going to reek the right future.
Dialogue: Oh, no. We're cool! Me and Reynn are totally going to reek the right future.

Original: Reynn:Sure are...
Dialogue: Sure are...

Original: Eiko:Well, it's not like I can stop you. The prophecy's about you, not me, right?
Dialogue: Well, it's not like I can stop you. The prophecy's about you, not me, right?

Original: Reynn:Duly noted.
Dialogue: Duly noted.

Original: Tama:So is there some special the-trick to getting to the tippity-top of Alexander?
Dialogue: So is there some special the-trick to getting to the tippity-top of Alexander?

Original: Eiko:Just get on. I'll handle the wake-up call.
Dialogue: Just get on. I'll handle the wake-up call.

Original: Lann:The what?
Dialogue: The what?

Original: Eiko:Alexander's kind of a sound sleeper. So it's my job to step in and sort of get things going.
Dialogue: Alexander's kind of a sound sleeper. So it's my job to step in and sort of get things going.

Original: Eiko:Now, off you go!
Dialogue: Now, off you go!

Original: Warrior of Light:I never believed it to be more than a legend... A bedtime story someone concocted to fill the dreams of children.
Dialogue: I never believed it to be more than a legend... A bedtime story someone concocted to fill the dreams of children.

Original: Warrior of Light:You won't find her.
Dialogue: You won't find her.

Original: Lann:Huh? How did we get ourselves dragged into battle?
Dialogue: Huh? How did we get ourselves dragged into battle?

Original: Girl Who Forgot Her Name:From this room, you can take control of your friends' destinies and redirect the course of their lives by fighting their most crucial battles.
Dialogue: From this room, you can take control of your friends' destinies and redirect the course of their lives by fighting their most crucial battles.

Original: Reynn:So it's like we're helping them in secret?
Dialogue: So it's like we're helping them in secret?

Original: Girl Who Forgot Her Name:You can think of it like that. Hey, get ready.
Dialogue: You can think of it like that. Hey, get ready.

Original: Warrior of Light:Whew... I'm glad that Her Highness is absent. The last thing I want is for her to be abducted again.
Dialogue: Whew... I'm glad that Her Highness is absent. The last thing I want is for her to be abducted again.

Original: Lann:Dah! What just happened?
Dialogue: Dah! What just happened?

Original: Reynn:When we do that, what does the other person experience?
Dialogue: When we do that, what does the other person experience?

Original: Girl Who Forgot Her Name:Even time must bend to the whims of fantasy.
Dialogue: Even time must bend to the whims of fantasy.

Original: Lann:Uh, that is totally confusing, but wow! So, we get to help a bunch of people out
Dialogue: Uh, that is totally confusing, but wow! So, we get to help a bunch of people out—

Original: Reynn:But in a way, there is a downside. With that much power, we could do just as much harm as we do good.
Dialogue: But in a way, there is a downside. With that much power, we could do just as much harm as we do good.

Original: Girl Who Forgot Her Name:I wouldn't say I'm a god in the sense you're thinking of.
Dialogue: I wouldn't say I'm a god in the sense you're thinking of.

Original: Girl Who Forgot Her Name:But if you misuse this power, you might not like the consequences.
Dialogue: But if you misuse this power, you might not like the consequences.

Original: Girl Who Forgot Her Name:Me and...him?is it "her"?well, our fates have entwined. So now that the two of you have made it to this place,
Dialogue: Me and...him?—is it "her"?—well, our fates have entwined. So now that the two of you have made it to this place,

Original: Reynn:We uh, won't mess around. I promise.
Dialogue: We uh, won't mess around. I promise.

Original: Soldier:Ugh... What am I gonna do...
Dialogue: Ugh... What am I gonna do...

Original: Soldier:Oh! You really brought me an earth hammer! I can't tell you how much I appreciate this!
Dialogue: Oh! You really brought me an earth hammer! I can't tell you how much I appreciate this!

Original: Male Lilikin:Oh! If it isn't the Jiants! I've heard you've been putting up a good fight against the Bahamutian Army.
Dialogue: Oh! If it isn't the Jiants! I've heard you've been putting up a good fight against the Bahamutian Army.

Original: Male Lilikin:This is great! Thanks to you, we were able to gather the data we need.
Dialogue: This is great! Thanks to you, we were able to gather the data we need.

Original: Male Lilikin:It seems that as long as we keep our distance from the plains, the goblins will keep their distance from us.
Dialogue: It seems that as long as we keep our distance from the plains, the goblins will keep their distance from us.

Original: Male Lilikin:Hey, hey, did you know about the nimble Mirages in the desert? They're really fast!
Dialogue: Hey, hey, did you know about the nimble Mirages in the desert? They're really fast!

Original: Male Lilikin:Whoa! You defeated some?! How are they?
Dialogue: Whoa! You defeated some?! How are they?

Original: Male Lilikin:Just wait! I'm gonna be the fastest runner that ever lived!
Dialogue: Just wait! I'm gonna be the fastest runner that ever lived!

Original: Male Lilikin:Hey...you're the Jiants from the Hills, aren't you? Is there any way you could lend me a hand?
Dialogue: Hey...you're the Jiants from the Hills, aren't you? Is there any way you could lend me a hand?

Original: Male Lilikin:Really? Thanks so much!
Dialogue: Really? Thanks so much!

Original: Male Lilikin:Are you telling me the Mirages are gone? All right! Thank you!
Dialogue: Are you telling me the Mirages are gone? All right! Thank you!

Original: Male Lilikin:Now they'll know to stay far away from our town!
Dialogue: Now they'll know to stay far away from our town!

Original: Female Lilikin:Excuse me. I'm sorry to bother you, but I was wondering if I could ask you a favor.
Dialogue: Excuse me. I'm sorry to bother you, but I was wondering if I could ask you a favor.

Original: Female Lilikin:You would? Oh, thank you... That's very kind of you.
Dialogue: You would? Oh, thank you... That's very kind of you.

Original: Female Lilikin:Oh, thank you! My grandson's going to be thrilled when he opens his present!
Dialogue: Oh, thank you! My grandson's going to be thrilled when he opens his present!

Original: Female Lilikin:Oh, thank you! My grandson's going to be thrilled when he opens his present!
Dialogue: Oh, thank you! My grandson's going to be thrilled when he opens his present!

Dialogue: Eee! It's really her! Those adorable eyes! That majestic presence! Oh, she's too wonderful for words!

Dialogue: If you want to talk flan again, you know where to find me!

Dialogue: You Jiants have been a great big helpity-help to me. Thanks to you, business is boomy-booming better than ever before!

Original: Female Lilikin:I can't stand it, I can't stand it, I can't stand it! Oh, I can't stand it. Why do those Mirages insist on causing me trouble?
Dialogue: I can't stand it, I can't stand it, I can't stand it! Oh, I can't stand it. Why do those Mirages insist on causing me trouble?

Dialogue: Hurry up and take care of those Mirages for me!

Dialogue: Bravo, bravo! You two are even more competent than I anticipated. Now I can finally enjoy my afternoon tea.

Dialogue: There you are. I've been waiting for you. There's another batch of Mirages standing between me and my tea. You'll take care of these for me too, won't you?

Original: Female Lilikin:Take care of this quickly, please. Tea leaves lose their flavor if they sit for too long...
Dialogue: Take care of this quickly, please. Tea leaves lose their flavor if they sit for too long...

Original: Female Lilikin:Ha ha ha ha! This is what happens to those who stand between me and my tea!
Dialogue: Ha ha ha ha! This is what happens to those who stand between me and my tea!

Original: Female Lilikin:Now there's nothing stopping me from enjoying a nice hot cup of tea. Thank you. Your help has been invaluable.

Original: Soldier:Ugh... What a pain... Huh? Say, you wouldn't happen to be the Jiants from the Hills, would you?

Dialogue: Good luck out there!

Original: Soldier:Hey, you're back! Thanks for doing my job for me... I mean, boy, does my arm hurt like the dickens!
